results.title: Stunts: fights and falls
results.creator_credit: Tim Barr and Tony De Zarraga
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Like good athletes, stuntmen must warm up before attempting any feats. Control and practice are of paramount importance. For realism rehearsal in the front of a camera and the matching of the movements of the actor and stuntman are essential. The narrator Jack Mohoney, as well as giving the historical background to stunts in films gives many hints on safety and training.

results.title: Stuntman
results.creator_credit: Media Extension Group and Tom Koester
results.brief_description: Follows stuntman Greg Anderson through a day’s work, highlighting the ways in which he performs his stunts, and the reasons which led him to choose his profession.

results.title: Studying Australian animals
results.brief_description: Scientific investigation of Australian animals at Monash University, illustrating modern technique and equipment in use. Research is shown on territorial behaviour of the Cape Barren Goose, the incubation mounds of the Brush Turkey, growth and temperature regulation of the Parma Wallaby, and hibernation of the Echidna.

results.title: Study tips (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Wayne’s exams are two week away and he is in a panic. With Uncle Jack’s help he develops a positive attitude towards study and more effective study techniques. With Lance Curtis and Geoff Kelso. This entertaining program provides simple tips on improving study skills, for lower and middle secondary school.

results.title: Study techniques
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that some postprimary students have in effectively organising their study times. Suggests how to balance the conflicting needs of sport, socialising and other leisure activities with study. Also shows techniques for effective study and mentions the skim, read and make notes, personalise, summarise and revise methods.

results.title: Study skills: take that test
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and James Novack
results.brief_description: Follows a classroom of students as they discover how to successfully take a test. Shows importance of not falling behind in studies; reviewing material; best approaches to take toward specific formats in which test questions are presented; most productive use of time alloted for the test.

results.title: Study Patterns Pt.2 (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Study Patterns”.
Encourages students to think about and improve their methods of study. Skills covered in part two of the series are; examination skills, numeracy skills, relaxation training, and units “if you are a mature student” and “if you are a disabled student”.

results.title: Study Patterns Pt.1 (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Study Patterns”.
Encourages students to think about and improve their methods of study. Skills discussed are basic skills; reading skills; writing skills; listening skills; participation skills; examination skills and practical skills.
